title: The Yearly Audit: Hard Truths
description: 100 brutal questions to ask yourself before the year starts. Based on the 'Region Beta Paradox' and the reality of growth.

cards.content: How has this year gone?
What went well this year?
What went badly this year?
Why did those things go badly?
What lessons did I learn from my failures?
What habit or system accounted for most of my success?
What are the most valuable ways I spend my time?
How can I find more time for my most valuable activities?
cards.back: What can you cut to make space?

cards.content: What brought me the most happiness this year?
How can I help my 'happy activities' happen more often?
Who are the people that had the greatest impact on me?
How can I see and collaborate with my favorite people more?
What did I expect to complete, but didn’t?
Is that unfinished goal still important to me?
cards.back: If yes, how will you ensure follow-through? If no, delete it.

cards.content: What are the least valuable ways I am spending my time?
How can I prevent myself from wasting time in that way?
cards.back: Set a boundary or remove the app.

cards.content: How have my goals or priorities shifted over the last few months?
Is there anything I am still doing that is no longer in alignment?
cards.back: Why are you still doing it?

cards.content: What was the Best Surprise of the year?
What was the Best Meal you ate?
What was the Coolest New Experience?
What was your Favourite Weekend?
What was your Favourite First Meeting?
What was your Favourite New City or Place?
What was your Favourite New Emotion?
What was your Favourite New Walk?
Who was your Favourite New Friend?
What was your Favourite Tour or Trip?
What was your Favourite Day of the entire year?
What was the Most Intense Week?
What was the Best Sex you had this year?
Who was your Favourite Artist this year?
What was your Favourite Song?
What was your Favourite Quote?
What would I do this year if I wanted to make 85-year-old me miserable?
cards.back: Inversion thinking. Are you doing these things now?

cards.content: What would 85-year-old me wish I did more of?
What are the things I do to make my day go great?
What things make my days go terribly?
What do I think is productive that actually isn’t?
What is productive that I don’t realise?
What do I want to do LESS of with my time?
What do I want to do MORE of with my time?
What does an ideal normal day look like?
What conversations do I need to have?
What are the habits I’m committing to STARTING?
What are the habits I’m committing to STOPPING?
What would have to happen by the end of next year for me to consider it a success?
Who do I need to become for next year’s chapter to turn out the way I want?
Knowing what I know now, what advice would I give to myself 12 months ago?
cards.back: You probably still need to hear this now.

cards.content: Am I optimizing for a résumé or a life?
What pain am I successfully numbing with distractions?
What is the 'one thing' that, if done, would make everything else easier?
Am I running TOWARD a vision or AWAY from fear?
If I repeated my today for the next 365 days, where would I end up?
What project is dragging on that I need to kill today?
Do I want the result, or do I just want to HAVE WANTED the result?
What is a boundary I need to set with work?
What is a boundary I need to set with family?
If I died today, would I be happy with my last conversation?
What area of my life is 'not bad enough to change' but 'not good enough to stay'?
Where am I tolerating mediocrity because it’s comfortable?
If my current situation got 10% worse, would I finally quit? Why wait?
What complaint have I had for over a year that I have done nothing about?
Am I waiting for a crisis to force me to change?
Which relationship is 'just okay' enough to keep me from finding a great one?
Is my job stimulating me, or is it just paying the bills comfortably?
cards.back: Comfort is the enemy of growth.

cards.content: What pain am I successfully numbing with distractions (phone, food, alcohol)?
If I knew I wouldn't fail, what 'good enough' thing would I drop today?
Am I suffering from 'comfortable misery'?
What is the cost of staying in this current state for another 5 years?
Where have I lowered my standards to avoid conflict?
Is my anxiety coming from doing too much, or knowing I’m capable of more?
What would 'rock bottom' look like for me, and why am I waiting for it?
Which daily habit is slowly draining me that I’ve learned to ignore?
Am I staying in this city/house because I love it, or because moving is hard?
Who am I spending time with out of habit rather than desire?
What dream have I put on 'snooze' because my current reality is bearable?
If I met myself as a stranger today, would I be impressed by my standards?
What is the one decision I know I need to make but am too comfortable to execute?
Am I willing to be misunderstood for the next 12 months?
Who in my life gets offended when I prioritize my goals?
Am I afraid of the 'Lonely Chapter' that comes with growth?
Which friends are anchoring me to my past self?
Can I sit in a room alone for 30 minutes without stimulation?
Am I seeking validation from people I wouldn't trade lives with?
Do I have the courage to outgrow my current peer group?
Is my fear of loneliness keeping me in bad company?
Am I creating noise (podcasts, music, scrolling) to avoid my own thoughts?
Who is supportive of my comfort but critical of my ambition?
Am I ready to be the 'boring one' at the party to be the successful one in life?
What social obligation do I dread that I need to cut out?
Am I performing a version of myself to please others?
If I disappeared for 6 months to work on myself, who would still be there?
Is my fear of missing out (FOMO) costing me my future?
Can I tolerate the boredom required to become a master at something?
Who do I need to stop explaining myself to?
Am I sacrificing my sleep for socializing that doesn't fulfill me?
Do I surround myself with people who are playing a bigger game than me?
Am I willing to walk alone for a season to walk with kings later?
What milestone am I waiting for to give myself permission to be happy?
If I achieve my biggest goal this year, will I actually like myself more?
Am I running TOWARD a vision or AWAY from feeling inadequate?
Whose voice is in my head telling me I’m not enough yet?
cards.back: Is it a parent? A teacher?

cards.content: If I couldn't tell anyone about my achievements, would I still pursue them?
Am I optimizing for a résumé or a life?
What 'trophy' am I chasing just to impress people I don't like?
If money and status were removed, what work would I still do?
Am I addicted to the stress of 'striving'?
Can I enjoy a sunset without taking a picture of it to prove I was there?
Is my ambition genuine, or is it a trauma response?
What small wins am I ignoring because they aren't 'big' enough?
Do I define my worth by my productivity?
If 2025 is exactly the same as 2024, will I be okay?
What part of my identity is tied to being 'the busy one'?
Am I solving problems, or do I just like having problems to solve?
When was the last time I felt 'done' for the day?
Am I building a life I want to live in, or a life I want to look at?
What compliments do I deflect because I don't believe them?
Who would I be if I stopped trying to be 'successful'?
What is the 'one thing' that, if done, would make everything else easier?
Where am I confusing 'busyness' with 'effectiveness'?
What 20% of my activities result in 80% of my stress?
What 20% of my activities result in 80% of my joy?
Can I say 'No' without offering an excuse?
What project is dragging on that I need to kill today?
Am I planning 2026 goals to avoid doing the work in 2025?
What is the single biggest bottleneck in my life right now?
If I could only work 2 hours a day, what would I do?
Am I procrastinating or just tired?
What am I researching endlessly to avoid taking action on?
Is my to-do list a wish list or a plan?
Where do I need to subtract rather than add?
Does my calendar reflect my stated priorities?
What am I doing just because I'm good at it, not because it matters?
Are my goals competing with each other?
Do I have a 'Stop Doing' list?
Am I waiting for motivation, or do I need discipline?
What is the friction that stops me from my good habits?
If I repeated my today for the next 365 days, where would I end up?
Is alcohol serving the person I want to become?
If I don't fix this now, what will my life look like in 2030?
Am I the limiting factor in my own life?
cards.back: Get out of your own way.

cards.content: Do I want the result, or do I just want to HAVE WANTED the result?
Am I dating people who are psychologically stable?
Is my 'type' actually just a pattern of trauma?
Do I listen to reply, or listen to understand?
Am I prepared to be bad at something new?
What is the conversation I am dreading that I need to have?
Is my environment designed for my success or my failure?
Do I keep the promises I make to myself?
Am I intellectually honest, or do I just want to be right?
What advice would I give someone in my exact situation?
Why am I not taking my own advice?
Is my phone a tool or a master?
Am I consuming more than I create?
What resentment am I holding onto that is poisoning me?
Do I actually want what I say I want?
If I died today, would I be happy with my last conversation?
If not now, when?
